p: As of April 4, two severe cases were observed. The first patient was a 54-year-old male identified at admission and who presented with symptoms 15 days prior to testing. Laboratory analysis revealed a low CD4+ T cell count; an Aspergillus species was isolated from sputum culture. The second patient was an elderly male (75 years) with no underlying health issues. Hematologic, biochemical, and infection-related indices were normal at admission. He developed a high fever, decreased appetite, diarrhea, and dyspnea within one week after admission. Two severe cases received noninvasive mechanical ventilation (NMV) support and glucocorticoid therapy. By April 4, both patients had been weaned from NMV and were stable. No critically ill cases were observed.
